poem:
Title: "In Lament for Perry, A Star's Passing"

Mamet's quill, midday, one iron jest, merged souls twine in artful wrest, 
Matthew, praised by Driver's heart, lunched in tales where minds depart.
A wealth unmeasured but in spirit, echoed laughter—hear it, hear it,
In Hollywood's ephemeral gleam, encounters fleeting as a dream.
Farewell, dear friend with humor's bounty, your star ascends the cosmic county.
